cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to sweep northeastward across the southeastern United States toward the southern Appalachians and the Carolinas by day-5
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near coastal Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: None (only warnings have been issued – no watches)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City LA eastward to the AL/FL border including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed (Boston, MA not in wind-probability table – probabilities <1%)
weather_observation.wind: Only breezy conditions (generally <25 kt) anticipated when the remnants pass well south of New England early next week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Massachusetts coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: A band of remnant moisture may bring 1–2 inches of rain to eastern Massachusetts 21–22 Jun, causing brief standing-water issues but no major flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None of operational significance for Boston container or cruise operations.
